column1: A stork bite is due to a stretching (dilation) of certain blood vessels.
A baby may be born with a stork bite.
Stork bites may be found on the forehead, eyelids, nose, upper lip, or back of the neck.
Most stork bites on the face go away completely in about 18 months.
Stork bites on the back of the neck usually do not go away.
